item.title: Word of the Day: rife
item.description: This word has appeared in 276 articles on NYTimes.com in the past year. Can you use it in a sentence?
item.dc:creator: The Learning Network

item.title: ‘The Daily Show’ Gives President Trump Yet Another Inaugural Award
item.description: Jordan Klepper congratulated the president, the sole nominee for “the Inaugural Award for Winning the Most Inaugural Awards.”
item.dc:creator: Trish Bendix
item.category: The Daily Show with Jon Stewart (TV Program)

item.title: Stop the Illegal Transfer of ISIS Suspects
item.description: The U.S. is sending thousands of men accused of belonging to the Islamic State from Syria to Iraq, where they face potential mistreatment.
item.dc:creator: Letta Tayler
item.category: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)

media:content.media:credit: Illustration by The New York Times

item.title: It Is Decision Time for NATO in Munich
item.description: The U.S. and Europe can save the trans-Atlantic alliance. They probably won’t.
item.dc:creator: Michael B.G. Froman

item.title: En Múnich, los líderes europeos se preguntan si podrán volver a confiar en EE. UU.
item.description: Funcionarios se reúnen el viernes para la mayor cumbre anual de seguridad de Europa, donde el discurso del vicepresidente JD Vance el año pasado inició una perturbación en las relaciones transatlánticas.
item.dc:creator: Steven Erlanger and Jim Tankersley

media:content.media:credit: Juliette Pavy para The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Una protesta contra la intromisión estadounidense en Groenlandia, en Nuuk, la capital, el mes pasado.

item.title: Japan Seizes Chinese Fishing Boat; Move Likely to Add to Tensions
item.description: The seizure of the trawler, which Japan said was sailing in its waters in the East China Sea, is likely to add to tensions between Tokyo and Beijing.
item.dc:creator: Javier C. Hernández

media:content.media:credit: Japan's Fisheries Agency, via Agence France-Presse — Getty Images
media:content.media:description: A photo released by Japan’s Fisheries Agency shows a Japanese patrol vessel, left, and a Chinese fishing boat off the coast of Nagasaki on Thursday.

item.title: Heated Rivalry and Marital Bliss: Two Wives Go Head to Head in a Scary Olympic Sport
item.description: One represents Belgium and the other Brazil in skeleton, in which the racer slides near-blind down an ice track at well over 80 miles per hour.
item.dc:creator: Heather Knight and James Hill
item.category: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships

media:content.media:description: Nicole Silveira of Brazil, left, and Kim Meylemans of Belgium, a married couple, are competing against each other, but they also have their own unit: Team BB.

item.title: Estos drones ucranianos no solo matan. También entregan víveres
item.description: El zumbido de cierto dron provoca alegría, no miedo, entre las tropas ucranianas: es el Vampire, que llega cargado de provisiones y cariño al frente de batalla.
item.dc:creator: Oleksandr Chubko and Cassandra Vinograd

media:content.media:description: Fruit and sweets being packed for soldiers on the front line.

item.title: Corrections: Feb. 13, 2026
item.description: Corrections that appeared in print on Friday, Feb. 13, 2026.

item.title: They Waited Until They Didn’t Have to Anymore
item.description: Jeff Melsheimer and Izzie Shea both had to be patient in their journey to find each other.
item.dc:creator: Stella Raine Chu

item.title: He Came With a Hearty Endorsement from His Ex-Fiancée
item.description: Danielle Garonce first noticed Daniel Grossman as “the fiancé who grows eggplants” on her friend’s Instagram. Once that engagement was over, they made their own match.
item.dc:creator: Valeriya Safronova

item.title: They Took a Swing at Dating Again
item.description: Ryan Smith and Andrea Gallo were both newly single when they met on an intramural softball league in New Jersey.
item.dc:creator: Jenny Block

item.title: Settled in Seattle After a Long-Distance Relationship
item.description: Samantha Smith and Aaron Davis fell in love with the city and each other while she was working as a traveling nurse.
item.dc:creator: Shivani Vora

item.title: I Had Buyer’s Remorse. It Almost Ended My Marriage.
item.description: When you can’t agree on the right city to live in, home can be more hell than haven.
item.dc:creator: Jackie Delamatre

item.title: Quote of the Day: Monks Offer Hope and Encouragement in Walk Across the South
item.description: Quote of the Day for Friday, February 13, 2026.

item.title: Trump Pardons Klecko, Jamal Lewis and Other Former N.F.L. Players
item.description: The players included Super Bowl champions and a Hall of Famer who had been charged for crimes ranging from perjury to drug trafficking.
item.dc:creator: Adam Sella

item.title: ‘The Unknown’ Review: Sean Hayes Turns One Man Into a Mystery
item.description: The chameleonic actor takes on several characters in David Cale’s solo play about a writer in pursuit of his stalker. Or is it all in his mind?
item.dc:creator: Helen Shaw

media:content.media:description: Sean Hayes in “The Unknown” at Studio Seaview in Manhattan.

item.title: Watch Choi Gaon and Chloe Kim Go Head to Head in the Halfpipe
item.description: The South Korean snowboarder Choi Gaon pulled off a stunning victory on Thursday in the women’s halfpipe final at the 2026 Olympics, capturing the gold medal and defeating the American Chloe Kim, the two-time defending champion.
item.dc:creator: Alice Fang, Jon Huang, Eden Weingart, Matt Ruby, Yuhan Liu, Avner Peled, Dan Powell and Marion Lozano

item.title: Republicans Ask Supreme Court to Intervene in N.Y. Redistricting Case
item.description: Lawyers for Representative Nicole Malliotakis, Republican of New York, asked the Supreme Court to block a ruling that would redraw her district lines.
item.dc:creator: Grace Ashford and Abbie VanSickle

media:content.media:credit: Valerie Plesch for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Representative Nicole Malliotakis’s lawyers have asked the Supreme Court to weigh in on a lower-court ruling that found that her district lines were unconstitutional.

item.title: ‘The Pitt’ Season 2, Episode 6 Recap: A Sudden Goodbye
item.description: A sudden death rattles the doctors and nurses at the Pitt a little more than usual. Meanwhile, the patients keep steaming in.
item.dc:creator: Sean T. Collins

media:content.media:description: The bad first day back for Dr. Langdon (Patrick Ball) continued with the death of a beloved patient.

item.title: NYT Crossword Answers for Feb. 13, 2026
item.description: Evan Mulvihill opens our solving weekend.
item.dc:creator: Sam Corbin

item.title: Ex-Leader of Norway Charged With Corruption Linked to Epstein
item.description: Thorbjorn Jagland, who briefly led Norway in the 1990s, had been protected by diplomatic immunity that came with his work with the Council of Europe, but that privilege was waived.
item.dc:creator: Ephrat Livni

media:content.media:credit: Stian Lysberg Solum/NTB Scanpix, via Associated Press
media:content.media:description: Thorbjorn Jagland, center left, a former prime minister of Norway, in Oslo on Thursday.

item.title: U.S. Aircraft Carrier Will Be Sent to the Middle East From Venezuela, Officials Say
item.description: The U.S.S. Gerald R. Ford is not expected to return until late April or early May.
item.dc:creator: John Ismay and Eric Schmitt

media:content.media:description: Aircraft carrier U.S.S. Gerald R. Ford in the Caribbean Sea last month.

item.title: How The Times Is Digging Into Millions of Pages of Epstein Files
item.description: Two dozen journalists. A pile of pages that would reach the top of the Empire State Building. And an effort to find the next revelation in a sprawling case.
item.dc:creator: Patrick Healy, Steve Eder, Andrew Chavez, Kirsten Danis and Dylan Freedman

media:content.media:description: A photo of Jeffrey Epstein with other faces redacted by the Justice Department.

item.title: Closing of El Paso Airspace Adds to Tension Between F.A.A. and Pentagon
item.description: The Federal Aviation Administration is charged with flight safety, and the Defense Department with national security. Those missions keep colliding.
item.dc:creator: Kate Kelly, Karoun Demirjian and Eric Schmitt
item.category: United States Defense and Military Forces

media:content.media:description: A passenger carried his suitcase at El Paso International Airport after the F.A.A. lifted its temporary closure of the airspace over El Paso.

item.title: Canada School Shooter’s Online Life Showed Interest in Violent Extremism
item.description: The suspect in the British Columbia shooting had long been posting about mental health problems, substance abuse and a fascination with weapons and online violence.
item.dc:creator: Matina Stevis-Gridneff, Aric Toler, Pranav Baskar, Malachy Browne, Amy Harmon and Vjosa Isai

media:content.media:credit: Alana Paterson for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: The family home where the authorities say Jesse Van Rootselaar killed her mother, Jennifer Jacobs, and her brother, Emmett Jacobs.

item.title: Live Updates: Bangladesh Nationalist Party Claims Victory in Pivotal Election
item.description: The B.N.P., led by Tarique Rahman, was heavily favored to win the first election since student-led protests toppled the last government in 2024. The official results are expected later on Friday.
item.dc:creator: The New York Times

media:content.media:credit: Lam Yik Fei for The New York Times

item.title: Goldman Sachs General Counsel Kathryn Ruemmler Resigns Over Epstein Ties
item.description: Kathryn Ruemmler, a former top Obama administration lawyer, is out at Goldman Sachs after emails showed a friendship with the sex offender Jeffrey Epstein spanning many years.
item.dc:creator: Rob Copeland, Maureen Farrell, Lauren Hirsch and Duy Nguyen

media:content.media:description: Kathryn Ruemmler, the general counsel at Goldman Sachs, in 2014. She said Thursday that her responsibility “is to put Goldman Sachs’s interests first.”

item.title: Federal Judge Blocks Trump Plan to Cut $600 Million in Health Funds
item.description: It is the latest court ruling staving off deep cuts to social services that Democratic-led states say are politically motivated and would harm hundreds of thousands of people.
item.dc:creator: Chris Cameron

media:content.media:credit: Dustin Chambers for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: The $600 million in cuts planned this month include grants to state and local public health departments. The funds are administered through the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention.

item.title: Judge Says Immigrant Detainees Near Minneapolis Must Have Proper Access to Lawyers
item.description: In a rebuke to the government, a federal judge in Minnesota said “the government failed to plan for the constitutional rights of its civil detainees” during its immigration crackdown in the state.
item.dc:creator: Christina Morales

media:content.media:credit: Jamie Kelter Davis for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Law enforcement officers outside the Whipple Federal Building near Minneapolis last month.

item.title: Partial Federal Shutdown Shrinks Congressional Presence in Munich
item.description: In a moment of frayed trans-Atlantic relations, Speaker Mike Johnson abruptly canceled the House delegation to Europe’s biggest annual security summit.
item.dc:creator: Megan Mineiro

media:content.media:description: Speaker Mike Johnson abruptly canceled the House delegation to the Munich Security Conference.

item.title: Prosecutor Seeks Dismissal of Charges Against Man Shot by ICE
item.description: The top federal prosecutor in Minnesota asked a judge to drop charges against the immigrant who was shot by an ICE agent, saying new evidence was “materially inconsistent” with what officials had claimed.
item.dc:creator: Mitch Smith

media:content.media:description: Federal agents clashed with protesters near the site of the shooting in Minneapolis.

item.title: Senate Democrats Block Funding for D.H.S.
item.description: After a heated Senate hearing that highlighted the partisan divide over immigration enforcement, Democrats voted to block funding for the Department of Homeland Security.
item.dc:creator: Jackeline Luna

media:content.media:description: Federal agents confronting protesters in Minneapolis last month.

item.title: The Epstein Files and the Hidden World of an Unaccountable Elite
item.description: The search continues in the documents for ironclad criminal conduct, but the story of a sexual predator given a free ride by the ruling class has already emerged.
item.dc:creator: Robert Draper

media:content.media:description: Redacted documents showing email chains from Jeffrey Epstein released by the Justice Department.

item.title: See How Gaon Choi Beat Chloe Kim in Women’s Halfpipe at the Winter Olympics
item.description: Choi came back after a hard fall during her first run, landing back-to-back 900s and ending Kim’s hopes of a third gold medal.
item.dc:creator: Weiyi Cai, Malika Khurana, Alexandra E. Petri, Bedel Saget, Jeremy White, Ashley Wu and Joe Ward

item.title: 5 Takeaways After Trump’s Immigration Crackdown in Minnesota
item.description: Some 3,000 agents took part in the federal operation that started late last year around the Twin Cities. On Thursday, officials said the surge would wind down.
item.dc:creator: Julie Bosman

media:content.media:description: A scene from January in Minnesota, where agents arrested a man.

item.title: ¿Los cárteles de la droga utilizan drones en la frontera?
item.description: Las autoridades estadounidenses advierten que los drones operados por cárteles en la frontera suponen una gran amenaza. Las autoridades mexicanas no están tan seguras. Los analistas dicen que la respuesta está probablemente a medio camino entre ambas posturas.
item.dc:creator: Jack Nicas and Paulina Villegas

media:content.media:credit: Alejandro Cegarra para The New York Times
media:content.media:description: El muro fronterizo entre México y Estados Unidos en Tijuana, México.

item.title: Police Seek 4 People After Teen Killed in Bronx Shooting
item.description: The police said they were seeking three men and one woman in connection with the shooting, which killed Christopher Redding, 16. Two other teenagers were injured.
item.dc:creator: Maia Coleman and Wesley Parnell

media:content.media:credit: Dakota Santiago for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: A teenager was killed and two others wounded in a shooting on a Bronx street.

item.title: Former N.Y.P.D. Official Is Charged With Soliciting Bribes
item.description: Kevin Taylor, who ran the School Safety Division, received cash, luxury hotel lodging and a helicopter ride for promising to help steer city contracts to a Florida businessman, prosecutors said.
item.dc:creator: Hurubie Meko
item.category: Eric Adams Federal Corruption Case (24 CR 556)

item.title: Seattle to Pay $29 Million to Family of Woman Fatally Struck by Police S.U.V.
item.description: The officer was traveling 74 miles per hour in a 25-m.p.h. zone when he hit Jaahnavi Kandula in a crosswalk while responding to a call.
item.dc:creator: Neil Vigdor

media:content.media:credit: Ken Lambert/The Seattle Times, via Associated Press
media:content.media:description: Jaahnavi Kandula’s relatives said they were grateful to reach a resolution in the case.

item.title: C.I.A. Video Appeals to Potential Spies in China’s Military
item.description: The agency is seeking Chinese officials who are frustrated with corruption in the People’s Liberation Army.
item.dc:creator: Julian E. Barnes

media:content.media:description: Members of the People’s Liberation Army attending a ceremony in December. Corruption in China’s military has hampered its push to modernize and improve capabilities.

item.title: Trump Repeals the Government’s Power to Regulate Climate
item.description: Also, an end to the surge of immigration agents in Minnesota. Here’s the latest at the end of Thursday.
item.dc:creator: Matthew Cullen

media:content.media:credit: Benjamin Rasmussen for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: The Four Corners Power Plant outside Fruitland, N.M.

item.title: The High-Stakes Fight Over Masked Federal Agents
item.description: The debate over whether federal agents should be allowed to cover their faces with masks has become a flashpoint as the government heads for a partial shutdown.
item.dc:creator: Luke Broadwater

media:content.media:description: A masked Customs and Border Protection agent during an arrest in Minneapolis last month.

item.title: In an Upset, Analilia Mejia, a Progressive, Wins a Democratic House Race
item.description: Ms. Mejia, a political organizer, beat her main opponent in the New Jersey primary, Tom Malinowski, by a narrow margin after he was battered by negative ads from a pro-Israel group.
item.dc:creator: Tracey Tully

media:content.media:credit: Rachel Wisniewski for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Analilia Mejia’s victory was considered an upset. She had entered the race late and was significantly outspent by many of her 10 opponents.

item.title: Mamdani to Resurrect Bus and Bike Lanes Killed by Eric Adams
item.description: The new projects, expected to be announced on Friday, will reverse decisions made by the Adams administration, and help the new mayor fulfill his vow to make buses fast and free in New York.
item.dc:creator: Dana Rubinstein

media:content.media:credit: Thalia Juarez for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: The new projects are expected to include offset bus lanes on Fordham Road, the busiest bus route in the Bronx.

item.title: A Love Letter to the Grand Romantic Gesture
item.description: In honor of Valentine’s Day, our readers shared moments when they felt truly swept off their feet.
item.dc:creator: Catherine Pearson

item.title: ‘We Don’t Know if the Models Are Conscious’
item.description: Have A.I. models already reached consciousness? Dario Amodei, the chief executive of Anthropic, is open to that possibility. He hopes for a relationship between humans and A.I. where “they want the best for you” but you still have your freedom and your will.
item.dc:creator: Interesting Times

item.title: Greg Brown, Guitarist Who Wrote Cake’s Biggest Hit, Dies at 56
item.description: His song “The Distance,” released in 1996, became an anthem for the disaffected members of Generation X.
item.dc:creator: Clay Risen

media:content.media:description: Mr. Brown in 1996. He left Cake after “Fashion Nugget,” partly over differences with the lead singer, John McCrea.

item.title: Anthropic Is Valued at $380 Billion in New Funding Round
item.description: The artificial intelligence start-up raised another $30 billion, and its valuation more than doubled since its last funding round in September.
item.dc:creator: Cade Metz

media:content.media:credit: Karsten Moran for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Anthropic was founded by Dario Amodei, right, and his sister, Daniela Amodei, who had parted ways with OpenAI.

item.title: Is A.I. Coming for Your Job?
item.description: This isn’t your grandparents’ revolution. Anthropic’s chief executive, Dario Amodei, says artificial intelligence will change our world faster than anything we’ve experienced before.
item.dc:creator: Interesting Times
